definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice

sentences.english: My heart often burned with indignation I knew not how to express.
sentences.chinese: 我经常感到义愤填膺，我真不知道如何表达。

sentences.english: You won’t often see abundance-minded people running the outrage script.
sentences.chinese: 你很少看到思想丰富的人奉行义愤脚本。

sentences.english: He walked to the door and opened it, prepared to accost an intruder with righteous indignation.
sentences.chinese: 他走上前去开门，义愤填膺地想向闯入者发难。
许多人都义愤填膺，溢于言表。

sentences.english: Chinese citizens rarely get a chance to seek revenge by vote.
sentences.chinese: 中国的公民很少有机会用选票来宣泄自己的义愤。

sentences.english: Personally I found it difficult to dump the outrage script.
sentences.chinese: 就我个人而言，很难完全抛开义愤脚本形事。

sentences.english: She waxes righteously indignant if anyone tries to contradict her.
sentences.chinese: 反驳她，她说起话来就会义愤填膺。

sentences.english: A phrase such as that will get some managers spluttering with indignation.
sentences.chinese: 这样一种说法会让一些经理感到义愤填膺。

sentences.english: Mr. Obama was dismissive when he should have been outraged.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马对此嗤之以鼻，他本应该义愤填膺。

sentences.english: Jesus told them to look at their own hearts before satisfying their righteous rage.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣让他们在一泄义愤之前先审视自己的内心。

sentences.english: I found similar indignation from polite but insistent students.
sentences.chinese: 从有礼貌但固执的学生身上我发现了类似的义愤。

sentences.english: I know that engagement with repressive regimes lacks the satisfying purity of indignation.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，与压制性政权接触没有义愤填膺来得畅快。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, there were instances of what Troyer describes as "moral outrage".
sentences.chinese: 然而，也有特耶叙述的“义愤填膺”的例子。

sentences.english: He couldn't control the indignation that swelled in his heart.
sentences.chinese: 他无法抑制胸中涌起的义愤。

sentences.english: The haughty voices of the Cannon sharpened the indignation of the international community against aggression.
sentences.chinese: 大炮威严的轰鸣尖锐地表达了国际社会对侵略的义愤。

definition: righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
variant of 憤恨|愤恨[fen4 hen4]
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
to speak out for justice (idiom); to take a stand on a matter of principle
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
